body.name: SilverStone Technology FARA 313 Compact Micro-ATX Tower Chassis with Excellent Drive Compatibility and Type-C Port, SST-FA313-B-C
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 19 mins
features: Perforated steel mesh front panel provides unobstructed air intake performance
Highly flexible storage options for 5.25", 3.5" and 2.5" drives
Shortened chassis design with precisely designed interior and excellent space utilization for components
body.description: FARA series is SilverStone’s collection of budget-friendly cases each containing its own unique set of features aimed at different users with different system requirements. FARA 313 is a compact Micro-ATX tower chassis with a clever interior design which allows for great component compatibility and tremendous storage drive flexibility while achieving excellent ventilation performance. The front panel of FARA 313 features a modest appearance with a large perforated mesh intake area; combined with a single 120mm fan slot at the front and rear of the chassis, ensures unobstructed front-to-back-directional system airflow. FARA 313 supports up to a Micro-ATX motherboard, with graphics card limitation of 354mm and CPU cooler height limitation of 156mm. Externally, there are 2 x 5.25” bay, and up to 3 x 3.5” HDD or 3 x 2.5” SSD bays internally, offering a substantial storage flexibility for users to mix-and-match different form factor drives; a rare sight these days in modern Micro-ATX enclosures. In summary, FARA 313 is suitable for users with high storage requirements while also seeking excellent cooling performance in a compact Micro-ATX case.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Clever space utilization For a compact build to thrive in a shortened Micro-ATX chassis, it’s crucial to not leave space unattended, thus FARA 313 includes multiple mounts for 2 x 5.25” device and 5 storage devices to utilize every inch of space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent classic case with some caveats
reviews.reviewText: If you're used to Silverstone mATX cases like the TJ08 or PS07, keep in mind this case is quite a bit smaller. There is almost no room to route any cables around the back of the motherboard. I was initally able to route the cpu 8 pin barely, but there's no way to route the 24 pin atx cable around the back. Depending on your goals, this may be fine. When I upgraded my PSU, I decided to just route the CPU power around the front instead. If you want to keep any cables tidy toward the bottom of the motherboard, you may want to get some zip tie adhesive mounts to stick to the bottom of the case.All that said, it looks fine, it works fine. I was able to mount a DVD drive and a 3.5" HDD hot swap in the two 5.25" bays. The first ATX PSU I used was 160mm depth, and I would recommend not going any deeper than that. I wanted a better quality PSU, though, and ended up switching to a 140mm depth PSU, which gives more room for managing the cables in the front.The 3.5" HDD cage is permanently riveted into the case, which is unfortunate, as I don't need it, and it's just in the way when installing the motherboard and when routing cables. Once you have your system installed, if you need to get the motherboard out for any reason, this fixed cage is going to make it more of a pain than it needs to be. Most modern mATX boards will take at least 2 m2 ssd's, and with the 2 5.25" bays, you could cram a lot of 2.5" sata ssd's or 3 3.5" HDD's if you make use of some good hot swap modules like Icy Dock has. Take a look at the Icy Dock MB604SPO-B or MB153SP-B for example. I have several Silverstone cases and I've removed the 3.5" drive mount cages from all of them (those were removable) as I find them unnecessary and antiquated. But of course, you're not buying this case if you're trying to be modern with the status quo, so YMMV.The rear fan is a 3pin that works fine. I had another 3pin Silverstone 120mm that I mounted up front, and the case airflow seems good for a case of this size. I'd recommend adding a 120mm front fan to get the best airflow.Overall, the case is a decent option in a niche market that's fading. I'm talking about classic computer cases that still have 5.25" bays. One other thing I miss is acrylic windows in side panels. Silverstone used to offer that on their TJ08 and PS07 cases, but no longer for whatever reason, despite still making those cases with solid side panels. I like acrylic windows, I like 5.25" bays, I like mATX, but unfortunately everything that I like is fading from the earth. C'est la vie.Happy building.
Worst case that I had it was bend right side and back side that I could not put back plate on it was damaged when received it and only had one usb on that front it was wasted my money on it
